snippet: The labor force growth is set to slow further over the next decade as more Americans retire, which will confine the economy’s growth, according to a government report.
abstract: Labor Dept reports number of United States job postings dropped 2.7 percent to still-healthy 5.4 million in October compared with September; hiring rose to 5.1 million.
lead_paragraph: The labor force growth is set to slow further over the next decade as more Americans retire, which will confine the economy’s growth, according to a government report.

headline.main: Hiring Increased in October, Report Says
headline.print_headline: Business Briefing; U.S. Hiring Rose in October, Though Job Ads Flagged
